title: AITA (21f) for not seeing the "problem".
body:
A hint of context - I'm childfree, I don't want kids, I have never wanted kids, kids have never been in my life plan.

 My Fiancé and i have been together for 6 years, dating 5, engaged 1. 

I'm currently 14 days late, and sicker than a dog that's eaten chocolate. 

Earlier this week my Fiancé (22M) noticed my lack of period and reminded me that we ran out of protection for 3 days at the end of last month, he did it so calmly that I hadn't realized what he was implying. 

I thought "huh that's weird but oh well christmas shopping needs done" and went on about my life as status quo. 

This where the asshole question comes into play.

I'm a smoker, outside and but often, and with my stomach and the holidays stressing me out I'm up to quarter a pack a day, my Fiancé wakes up to me chilling on the porch calm as a cucumber and minding my own business, and starts screaming about smoking while pregnant. 

I'm not and I told him just as much, but it sadly doesn't end there. 
He starts accusing me of not taking a test because I hate children, and saying I'm ignoring the obvious.

I inform him of the following important tid-bits

A) I have Endo and Crohn's, my stomach is always a mess.

B) I'm a grown women, I know my body.

C) I wouldn't be keeping it even if that was the "problem"

I'm a student with big plans that don't include unplanned children, I've never hidden this fact.

He thinks I'm TA for not "caring enough to take a test", potentially harming his unborn son and not considering what he wants for my life and my body.

My friends are split between me being totally right, and me being in denial and inconsiderate so I figured I'd leave it all to y'all.

TLDR: Am I the asshole for knowing my body and not wasting a dollar to confirm nor deny his accusations?

Editing for an Update:
3 negatives and I'm still getting the on/off silent treatment. He's now insisting on a blood test, because his mother "dreamt of a son and she's never wrong about these things."

title: AITA for not moving seats on the bus?
body:
I (20M) got onto a not-so-crowded bus (there were empty seats here and there) and sat down in an empty seat next to a woman, mid-twenties.

After a few minutes, having settled into my seat, the woman turns to me and tells me to sit somewhere else because her "boyfriend was going to sit next to her". I asked her when her boyfriend will be doing so, to which she replied that he'll be getting on in 15 minutes or so. I told her that I'll be getting off in three stops which would be around 10 minutes' time, and reassured her that I'd be gone by the time her boyfriend gets here.

She didn't back down and kept telling me to "fuck off to another seat". I probably would have done so had I not been carrying quite a heavy bag, but in this instance it was very inconvenient especially since it had been a few minutes since I'd put my bag down.

She proceeds to tell me that her boyfriend will "beat me up" if I don't move right now, and to that I laughed, reminding her that I'd be getting off before I even see this boyfriend of hers, so I tell her to fuck off. 

She kept on cursing at me under her breath after that, occasionally saying things like "I swear I'll shove this boot up your face". 

What was her problem? Am I the asshole for not moving?

Edit: and I did indeed get off before her boyfriend got anywhere near the bus, presumably.

title: AITA for telling my mom that she is destroying my life?
body:
My mom (F48) is a great woman she is friendly she is always calm and everyone likes her. she is just perfect, but when it comes to me (M17) and my sister (F14) she is manipulating, screaming all the time, malicious and she doesn't believe a word of what we say (She also has a habit of comparing me with other people 3 or 4 times a week).

6 years ago, when I got my first phone, she always grabed my phone and searches through my messages with my friends. I confronted her and told her that this makes me feel that she doesn't trust me. She told me that all mothers do this to protect their kids and that it has nothing to do with not trusting me and as a kid I believed her.
1 year later I locked my phone, she asked me about it and I told her that I prefer not to tell her the password because my friends share their secrets with me and it's not right for her to know about it. She told me that she understands and that she prefers to keep it unlocked in case that she needs something, as a kid I believed her again.
I started noticing that she opened WhatsApp and Facebook and (my phone kept track of everything that I opened with time). I asked her and she said that this is for my safety.
I didn't buy it this time and I told her to stop reading my messages and that I'm keeping the password.
She screamed at me and said that I am not honest with her and that I'm hiding something. 

she once told me that she doesn't trust me and that she thinks that I may be watching porn and smoking cigarettes as all my friends are not good persons and stuff like that, I got mad at her and I told her to stay away from my private life and that I'm not telling her anything again, ever since I became very secretive about everything and I never told her anything ever again.

I don't believe in God, but I come from a religious family so I have to act like I do, however I try to not go to church, but she wants me there 7 days a week for 3 hours each day. I believe that my school grades and my gym workout is more important so I go to church once a week. And she keeps telling me that the most important thing if I want to succeed in life is to make her and god happy. I study really hard as I want to have a decent job and a good life, but she thinks that 3 hours a day in church is better for me that 3 hours studying.

Not long ago I was having a free day (I do that once every month and I don't study in it) she came to the room, started screaming at me and told me how much of a disappointment I am and how much my siblings are better than me and my cousins and literally anyone she knew. Then I told her to get out of my life and that she doesn't help me by saying that she is literally destroying me and destroying my life I told her to leave me alone. The fight was like that for an hour or 2 and then I got tired and told her that she is right and I actually am a disappointment so please leave me alone.
AITA?

title: AITA for being pissed when my boyfriend pushed back our date night?
body:
My boyfriend (30M) and I (27M) both have really demanding jobs and normally see each other on weekends with one evening together during the week. It's a good balance for both of us.

His company recently landed a large account which means he's been doing a few months of really intense work, staying late every evening and going into the office on weekends. We've been lucky to see each other once a week if that. We had planned to get together after he finished at the office last Friday. There was a conference call scheduled to end at 6, and he said he'd see me after that, we'd go out and then spend the night at his place.

I was really looking forward to it because, while not totally uncommon, going weeks without time together does strain our relationship. And I know how hard he's been working, so I took the time to come up with some ideas for our date night with him in mind, which included picking up his favourite wine and some dessert for when we got back to his. Anyways, I text him close to the end of his meeting and ask him when he wants to meet up and what he's in the mood for, and don't hear back until 7 pm. At that point, he tells me he'll see me around 9:30/10. I got angry -- I haven't complained once about his long hours -- and told him to forget it. He had the whole evening free but wanted to decompress and go to the gym and didn't think to let me know earlier. We've since talked about it, and he said I shouldn't have been angry because we would still have seen each other and that I definitely shouldn't have cancelled our date night because he was looking forward to it and was disappointed. AITA?

title: AITA? My step-mother ruined my wedding reception
body:
My wife (F31) and I (M31) got married a little over a year and a half ago. During the ceremony my brother in law on my wife’s side of the family got up to the pulpit and said a few bible verses and proceeded to mention a few family members that had passed away that we wished could have been there. My wife’s mother was mentioned because she had passed away and my grandma was also mentioned as well.  My step-mother’s mom had also passed away but wasn’t mentioned.  We didn’t chose to not mention her because of any ill reasons but because we would have been there all day if we were to list off everyone. We simply picked 1 person each side of the families and proceeded to say “and everyone else that contributed to us being here today”.  My step-mom was irate that my grandma was picked over her mom. She proceeded to go to the reception afterwards and completely act like an asshole all night. She refused to participate in any dancing, eating, or pictures.  I wasn’t aware that she was acting like this because I was occupied with pictures, dancing, and socializing with everyone there.  Towards the end of the night I stepped outside with my best man to have a cigar and   recapped the day but that was when she cornered me to tell me that it was bullshit that my grandma was mentioned over her mom. That it was disrespectful of me to chose my mom’s family over hers. I was completely blown away by what she had said. I explained that it wasn’t meant to be disrespectful or a slight to anyone that we didn’t mention. She wouldn’t hear a word of what I was saying, I was simply in the wrong to her and that was final.

We haven’t spoken to this day. Even when my paternal grandfather passed away. She wouldn’t come anywhere near me then.  My dad said that she makes his life a living hell everyday because of what happened.

So am I the asshole here??? I don’t know what to anymore.

Edit: Fun facts for that day

Just so you all know that there were plenty of assholes that day...

My maternal grandfather was not invited to wedding due to the fact that he was the cause that my grandma passed away.  His presence would have caused many people not to stay or even show up to my wedding. I despise that man and openly admit it that I hate him.

My mom’s sisters caused a scene by getting drunk prior to the reception and getting into a fight in the parking lot. Security had to be called to escort them off the property.

My step-mom’s sister made my photographer cry by criticizing her work.  I had to calm her down and make things right.  We were happy with her pictures so we had no idea why she was being yelled at.

title: WIBTA if I report my mom to the authorities?
body:
Obligatory I'm on mobile, English is not my first language yadda yadda. Also the country I'm living in is Germany. 


Backstory:
A few years ago my mum started believing in conspiracy theories, went from pretty open minded to racist and started sharing populist thoughts basically saying stuff like "there's a NWO organisation, Merkel is the granddaughter of Hitler, the white population is being infiltrated by non-whites and its being replaced by those filthy immigrants" etc. etc.
This of course caused many arguments and disparities between her and the rest of the family since we all tend to be open minded and think that these kinds of thoughts are just complete and utter bullshit.

Now onto the main part:
A few months ago after my mum got diagnosed with cancer and after my stepdad at that time left her she started dating this guy who's sharing these thoughts as well if not even a tad bit more extreme. For example I know that he's a flat earther and doesn't like the way our system works, especially the school system since the kids are being "indoctrinated the wrong thoughts and are being teached unnecessary shit".

I'm 19, my sister is 15 and has never been particularly good in school. My mum decided to take her out of school and to "homeschool her at the school of life" when she's ready, which is btw illegal since it's the parents responsibility to ensure the kids get the education and send them to school. 
My mum obviously doesn't want to have any of that "indoctrination" in state schools being pressed into her kids head, that's why she took her out. 
We argued a lot about this decision since I suspect that my sister will just use the time outside school to not do anything and therefore loosing contact to how the real life is, not getting a degree and not being able to not make anything out of herself. 

I and others from my family also fear that she'll try teaching my sister things that are coming from her reality. Things like those mentioned above, that the holocaust wasn't real and the allies faked it and that the talk about climate change is a huge scam caused by idk who.

I'm having thoughts of reporting my sisters absence and my worries to authorities which would mean that my sis would be forced to go to school and I'd probably be dead for my mother since I betrayed her.


So WIBTA if I reported her to the authorities for neglecting my sisters education and probably destroying her future?

title: AITA for poking some fun at my friend's play?
body:
First of all please excuse anything that sounds strange, since English is my second language.

One of my (19f) dear and close friends (19m) takes part in a drama group of our campus. He just started last summer and honestly, he's really good considering he never seriously did theatre plays before. He also says it helps him a lot with school stress which is always good.

Anyhow, this is a small and relatively new group. They've only been in one competition in the last two years. It's also disorganized since it has bunch of different people with their own personal obligations. My friend always makes fun of their inability to agree about rehearsal and complains about the incompetence of some members who're literally just another person's friend or a cousin.

Well here's the thing, they recently did a short French play "The Chairs" and I came to watch it. Most of the audience was friends, family, classmates of the students in the group. My friend was really good if you ask me because he actually put in effort, but the play looked rushed and disorganized. A lot of the people forgot their lines or just didn't know how to understand them, so there were some awkward silences.

Some of us classmates hung out later and people started commenting the play. One girl pointed out how some actors just basically didn't understand their lines. Nobody disagreed so I joked that there's a lot of nepotism in that group (half of them being cousins, friends) and that's why they don't even try to be good.

I probably said that weirdly because my friend got mad. He told me later in private that it's embarassing for me to criticize him and his friends so openly, and that I should tell him one-on-one about these opinions. So he thinks I was referring to him in the nepotism part because one of the people in the group is his best friend. That's not true, I think he's one of the best actors but he's not convinced now, he thinks it was a passive-aggressive comment. I think he's also angry because I said that while the guy he likes was in the room, but that's just my guess.

Anyway AITA? It seems like this turned into a situation where my friend thinks he can poke fun at his fellow group members and the whole dynamics but because I did it that was over the line. However they were doing a public play so is it really disrespectful to give criticism, even if they're not expected to be amazing because they're all friends and they do plays for fun not quality?

title: AITA for charging for work I do for someone I’ve been dating long term?
body:
I recently saw a post about a man charging his wife for tech support and it inspired me to post.

Background: My (29F) partner (31M) works in finance and his workload sometimes becomes untenable. I’ll step in and do some of his work for him but when it’s more than what you would do for a friend ie being a second pair of eyes or what you would consider academic dishonesty in school, I ask that I be paid for my time.There hasn’t been objections so far from him but some of my friends think I’m TA for asking because we have been dating for almost three years and I should support him/we are a team/I shouldn’t even be asking in the first place. Some think it’s gross that I’m charging money for my time when we’re supposed to be a team.

I personally think I should be compensated for my time since the work I’m doing requires quantitative expertise and I value my time and abilities. Another point that may or may not be relevant is that he has received huge bonuses in the past and though I can’t attribute it directly to the work I do for him I do think that the sheer volume of his work done is higher than others so that has bumped his comp up significantly. I had asked for the work I do for him be paid prior to this fact.

AITA?

AITA?

title: AITA for refusing to present my group project and therefore letting my classmates embarass themselves?
body:
I(20f) am a university student and as part of my major i have to take an advanced french class.

Because of the current wildfires in Australia my french teacher decided that as a speaking exercise me and my classmates had to write different speeches about climte change felt throughout the world. Each group was given a different scenario and my teacher emphasized to use suitable words and expressions for our scenarios.

I was paired up by my teacher with two girls that i don't know very well. Our task was to write a 2 minute speech about the Great Barrier reef dying to the Climate Summit (in french)

One of the girls in my group proposed the idea that our speech should center around the idea that "if we were mermaids, how would we feel about our home dying around us?" Her idea for a speech began like this: "Have you ever thought about being a mermaid?"

The other girl in my group was all for it but i said that since our speech is supposed be held in front of the Climate Summit her idea isn't that suitable for our scenario.

We eventually found a better idea and moved on. 
After the lesson ended the first girl said that since we only have to present our speeches next lesson she wants to take our speech home and finalize it.

The next lesson comes around and the first girl had -with the second girls knowledge- changed the entire speech back to the original mermaid one. I was shocked.

The two girls said that since they wrote the speech i should present it in front of the class. Normally i would have done that but since i never agreed to the actual speech i told them there's no way i would do it. So both of them presented it and it was a shitshow.

Everybody in my class either chuckled or was just shocked. Even my teacher said our speech was "interesting". 

The two girls were VERY mad at me for letting them bomb in front of the class. The speech doesn't have any impact on grades and was just for practice but they embarassed themselves nevertheless.

So AITA for refusing to present our super bad speech and letting them embarass themselves?

title: AITA argument with a friend over tattoo ethics
body:
I (17 F) have a friend (17 F) who I have been butting heads with repeatedly over the past 9 months or so, but lately we have come to an unsteady peace. However yesterday she texts the groupchat an image of some art asking if it'd make a good tattoo, it's a snake with some roses, nothing revolutionary but still pretty. we're all like "yeah looks nice" but then she goes on to talk about changing 1 aspect (making the snake in the photo be the same as her pet snake) but having the rest exactly copied. I try to tell her that tattoo artists won't usually trace other artist's works, and even changing something might not be enough if you still want the rest of it traced, and that it's kind of plagiarism of the original art. She refuses to listen saying "it's online and public" and "I don't really care" which, I understand falling in love with a specific piece of art, but doing anything, even things that in the tattoo community are considered ethically wrong to obtain it? not cool. 

Later the same day I send her an article (https://www.cbc.ca/arts/getting-a-tattoo-of-your-favourite-art-these-tips-will-help-you-do-right-by-the-original-artist-1.4750259) basically saying, if you want a tattoo specifically of a non-tattoo artist's work, you should try to contact them and ask permission first. I can see how pushing the point this far is kinda making me the asshole, but I also feel really strongly about respecting the artist, especially if you like their art enough to have it tattooed on you. I sent the article and said "if you care that much about the art, I think you should also care enough to give the artist their due respect, and I don't wanna upset you by saying this but I just think it's the right way to do things" and then she's like "I already explained myself, I get that you think it's important but it isn't to me so let's just agree to disagree" and then said she got it off pinterest (pretty sure there's entire youtube videos cursing out people who do that but I didn't say anything) and that she tried to dig deeper and find the artist but couldn't and therefore wasn't worried and wasn't gonna keep trying. 

I'm just mad because of how willfully ignorant I think she's being. I'm a little deeper into the tattoo community, I go with my cousin when he gets his, I've been planning mine and watching tons of videos on them since around age 12, so I guess that's why what she did really hit a nerve for me, but I just see her attitude towards this and really ignorant and disrespectful towards the original artist. I'm cutting ties with her anyways because this is one of a very long string of arguments, but I just wanted some opinions. Thanks!

title: AITA for not wanting to go along with my fiancé’s wedding attire wishes?
body:
Throwaway account here. This feels a little crazy.

AITA??

title: AITA for giving wife ultimatum about drinking?
body:
My wife (33F) and I (36M) have been married for 7 years.  She has always been a drinker, but when we were in our mid 20's it was fun and harmless and just what you do.  

As time has progressed and we are now firmly in our 30's, I've become much more affected by her behavior.  Over the years, here are some of the behaviors I've come to loathe:

1. Will get drunk 4-5 nights a week when she is at her parents lake house (So approx 4 months a year)
2. She's had some embarrassing scenes over the years, falling down in public, needing to be carried to bed, getting kicked out of a bar for intoxication.
3. Got hammered 2 Christmas's ago and doesn't remember any of the family traditions or the evening in general
4. Crashed a neighbors party hammered and had to be escorted out
5. Got kicked out of a concert for public intoxication

These events span 3-4 years, so not all at once.

I've become fairly cold and disconnected.  I count her drinks, dread nights out and generally feel very trapped as any event that should be fun could be tainted by her drinking.  I dwell on these things and have a hard time forgiving her.

The other night I finally sat her down and told her if she can't stop driving, it's over.  She went on a tirade about how everything is always all about me and what I want and how I always want to change her.  I didn't really have an argument, I do want to change her, and this is something I want.

AITA?

title: AITA for "showing off" with money?
body:
For the last 4 years I (M23) have constantly been trying to get out more and do my own thing during holidays instead of just tagging along with my parents. Nothing too fancy usually. Going to a bar, eating at the 10$ all you can eat chinese restaurant, grill party, paintball, etc. It was also then when I noticed that my friends had poor budgeting skills. Usually they came once, escalated it (e.g. renting out the whole VIP lounge or renting a limo), then had absolutely zero money (if they didn't get themselves in debt for it) for the rest of the week/month/year. I love to go on holiday, and while we've been to Prague last year, they usually can't go on holiday. 

Because of that I had to learn to be happy travelling/eating alone, and I've picked up a "tag along or leave it" mentality. I maybe ask once if someone wants to go anywhere and if nobody says anything I'll just say I'll go to X and tell them I'd be happy if someone comes but I'll go anyways. 

Since most of the time I'm going alone, I've started using more money. So instead of e.g. taking a 1h flight with easyjet I'll fly to America/Korea/etc., sometimes business for comfort. Or get a nice steak instead of fried chicken. 

Now for some reason this has pissed one of my friends off. He told me I was showing off and being fucking arrogant by asking them if they wanted to come, since they couldn't afford it anyways (technically they could if they stopped wasting it on pretending to be rich, but that's besides the point). AITA for doing things and trying to get my friends to be more active? Should I just fuck off without ever asking?

title: AITA for telling my friend’s girlfriend that she looks like a specific porn star?
body:
One of my best friends Toby (20M) has been with his girlfriend Abby (19F) for almost a year now. I (20M) met her quite a few times and she seems like a down to earth gal. She’s not known to be jokey type of person. I always thought she looked like a celebrity, but could never put my finger on exactly who. I told them about this, but they couldn’t figure out who I’m thinking about either. 


I went to Toby’s apartment to make dinner with him yesterday and Abby was also there. It finally clicked. I was watching porn a couple of days ago and the person she looked very much like is the pretty porn star Ashly Anderson (23F). I told Abby that. They looked it up and agreed that they look very much alike. 


Abby asked me why I watch porn if I already have a girlfriend (20F). I said it’s normal. Toby said it’s not normal and asked me if my inability to get hard sometimes to my girlfriend is because I watch too much porn. I told him that’s not cool to share that information with Abby and his roommate (20M) within earshot. 



Abby said it’s not cool to watch porn if you already have a girlfriend. She said she’ll talk with my girlfriend about this. I told her to butt out of private life. She asked me if my girlfriend didn’t know I watch porn. I told Abby that it’s normal for guys in relationships to watch porn, but that doesn’t mean we have to tell our girlfriends that and possibly make them feel insecure. 


She asked me if this conversation ever came up with my girlfriend and I lied about not watching porn. I told her to just mind her own damn business. She said she was just kidding about planning to tell my girlfriend this. I told her she better be kidding. Toby told us to chill. We did. When I left, I told Abby again to not tell my girlfriend. She said “we’ll see”.

title: AITA for binning my flatmate's stuff?
body:
Sorry if this isn't very well made, first time posting. I know the title sounds vague but I'll get into it.

A bit of background first, I (19M) started university in September and moved into accommodation for students where I got 3 other random flatmates. 2 of which I get on with but 1, I'll call S, doesn't really speak to us much and spends most of his time in his room playing loud music. S makes no attempt to get to know the people he is living with. 

Fast forward a few weeks, I finish uni and try and get some sleep as I have work in the morning to be woken up by loud banging and shouting at about 3am. I work early shifts so I was not impressed. In the morning, I go to make breakfast to see that S had brought some friends over while drunk and had stacked up all of the kitchen stuff they could into the corner of the room. Like they literally unplugged the microwave (something that is owned by the accommodation, so if it's broken the 4 of us will get a fine) and carefully balanced it on top of the pile. I was quite pissed off but quickly got ready for work and set off because I have early shifts. When I got home the mess was sorted out so I thought nothing of it. People do stupid stuff for a laugh when they're drunk I get it haha. What really annoyed me was what my flatmates found the next day. They also tried moving the fridge but failed to do so. However, they did unplug it and lots of food went bad.

Skip to the Saturday just gone. I was working both Saturday and Sunday and S had friends over on both days. Saturday night I go in to see the entire room had been hotboxed (for those who don't know, that's when the doors and windows are shut and blocked so that the room is filled with smoke). They weren't just smoking tobacco by the smell either. Since they were all drinking too, I couldn't talk to them since they were so out of it, if you know what I mean. Sunday morning I go in the kitchen to see a similar sight. Sock still covering smoke alarm, beer bottles/cans all over the floor etc. There was rubbish all over the sides too since the bin was full. I changed the bag for the bin. I saw that S had left a lot of stuff laying around the kitchen such as phone chargers, extensions for cables and stuff like that. I just grabbed it and put it all in the trash. I knew talking to S would do nothing as I've tried in the past but he just replies with "sure". What made it worse was the fact that they had eaten some of our food that night too. Just straight up stolen from the fridge. There were kinda a few not so cheap things I threw away like the phone chargers but S clearly has no respect for us. I've thought about reporting him and I think I will soon.

I'm just wondering if this makes me a bad person. AITA for throwing away my flatmates ashtrays, drinks and wires? I know what I did was petty and wrong.

Sorry if I haven't included enough info. I can go on but I'd hit the word limit haha

title: AITA for accepting a work shift during a day me(M19) and my GF(F18) were gonna hang out b/c my manager has been accommodating for us in the past?
body:
To start I kind of expect the "YTA' to roll in bcuz it admittedly is a mess up on my part.  I just want some opinions on if you think my girlfriends response is overblown or not.

We are hanging out the sunday/monday of labor day weekend and she is sleeping over at my house that sunday night.  She starts school soon after this and we wont be able to see each other cuz of distance and we've been looking forward to this upcoming weekend.

Well today at work my manager out of desperation asked if i could cover an 11-5 shift because absolutely no one else was able to without way over working one guy.  I hesitated but accepted, knowing that this would cut into our time because:

1. i like my manager becuase she has accommodated for us in the past, giving me days off to spend with my girlfriend even if they were busy times, so I felt morally obligated to help her out.
2. we've done the same exact thing in the past where i've had to work one day of the two day visits and she usually tries to get some work done and sometimes comes visits me where I comp her food.

well when I told her I was sorry but this had to happen she blew up.  Demanded that i fix it by telling work nevermind I couldn't.  I didnt feel this was right so I talked to my manager about possibly switching it and theres nothing really she could do.

I now have my GF calling me repeatedly to get me to respond to her texts and threatening that she will make my life hell if i dont fix it. saying ive ruined everything even though that monday shift would take up less than a 6th of our time that weekend not even counting that I'll see her multiple times during the week.  

I know i messed up, but i made the decision the best I could and shes done nothing but berate, threaten, and say "fuck you fix it" to me.

title: WIBTA if I move out and leave my family with no source of income?
body:
Throwaway account.

Ok so a bit of backstory, my (24F) father (50M) passed away last year. He was the sole source of income in my family, and he had some money saved bc he had a lot of health issues. When this happened everyone in my family was already over 18. 

My older brother (25M) lived with him and worked for him, after my father's death he disappeared and spent all the savings in about a month (no idea if he was robbed, made a lot of bad choices, was malicious or just had a mental breakdown), we picked him up in another state after he called us from a public phone and looked like he had been living in the streets for a while, he was, and maybe still is, a drug addict. title: AITA For expecting my Ex to pay for a portion of his birthday.
body:
Okay, so a lot of detail I don't really want to go into all of it but I will try to make it as clear as possible. 

Me and my ex are splitting, finding new places as of 7/1. We both have lots of respect for each other. He is an amazing father to our daughter and I give him nothing but props for that.

The sticky shit comes into our income, me (32 F), make a bit more than him (33 M), as such I have had to bare a lot more of the financial burden, despite him reassuring me in the beginning of our relationship that I would never have to carry him.  This became an issue and, as far as I believe, became the thing that ended our relationship. 

Fast forward...we are both mature adults and love our child very much. She is and will alway be the most important thing to us, so we get along fairly well. His bithday is this weekend. I thought for a send off we would do something for his birthday. 

He picked dinner and a strip club. No problem. We both were not super hungry so we went to a local bar and grabbed a few drinks and an app. I paid for the whole tab. Then went to the strip club, I took out 200 and gave him 60 in cash for singles, I paid for covers and drinks. I also bought him 2 private dances.

I ran out of cash, when I went to the ATM despite having money in my account the ATM said I had "exceeded my withdraw limit" so I could not get any more cash. I told him we had a few options. 1) we Uber (we had both been drinking) to the nearest location of my bank and hope the ATM there lets me take out more, or 2) we go home because I was out of cash. He then tells me he has $100 he can spare in his account and to just Venmo me later. 

This kinda triggers me and let me explain why. For my 30th (my last BD) he paid me back for tickets to a concert and called this his present. I honestly don't really like the band, but he does. He begged me to buy tickets to this show for weeks and just because it was close to my birthday he presented it as his birthday present to me. Honestly I felt cheated of my 30th. So I paid 100% for a trip to NYC to see a show I actually wanted to see, including food/hotel/ticket for us both. 

I cried most of the Uber home, which I paid for,  I just feel used. He hasn't spoken to me since (just a few hours, but still, idk). 

Was it wrong to get mad that he assumed I would be paying for 100% of his birthday when he didn't really do that for mine? Let me know...

title: AITA for not chaperoning my sister
body:
A little background, my(19F) sister (21F) (let’s call her Ashley) goes on a lot of first dates. She’s the kind of person who will go on a few dates and say the relationship has lost its “spark” and move on (no judgement here).

 Usually the guys Ash meets are from friends or blind dates and she likes to have me there as backup incase the guy is a creep. I genuinely don’t mind doing this. For the double date part she says it feels less awkward if I’m also “on a date” so Ashley usually finds a guy for me to go with or I bring a friend. I always like to make sure the people she sets me up with know I’m not interested in anything with them and I’m just there to support Ashley but lately they haven’t taken the hint and IM the one left dealing with creeps. I’m also talking to a guy and while we aren’t in a definitive relationship I know he would be uncomfortable with me going out with someone else even for the purpose of helping Ashley. 

So this is basically how our text conversation went:

Ash: Double date on Sunday (place and time)

Me: Alright sounds good can I bring (my guys name)

Ash: Already promised another guy he would be your date maybe next time 

Me: I’m not exactly comfortable with going out with strangers anymore, would you mind finding someone else this time?

No response. An hour later she gets on social media and talks about how some people are so unreliable and basically a long rant pointedly talking about me. My other siblings noticed this and told me that I was a jerk for cancelling on her and I should stop being a child and just go. 

I feel like I didn’t do anything wrong but now I’m thinking I shouldn’t have left Ashley hanging so AITA?

title: WIBTA if I told my mom I don't want to visit my uncle anymore?
body:
I'm 13F if that matters. My mom takes me and my younger brother (9) to visit our uncle every weekend. He can't walk well anymore because of a neurological illness and I feel sorry for him. But he's also become a really difficult person. He used to love me and my brother visiting but now we're scared of doing anything around the house because he could yell at us. He basically freaks out if we just move a chair in the dining room. Our mom helps him and his roommate with chores but he just cries or lashes out at them. The whole weekend is the three of them fighting over stupid things and my brother and I have to go distract ourselves somewhere else.

WIBTA if I told my mom me and my brother prefer to stay at home when she visits our uncle? Thanks.

title: AITA for wanting some boundaries in a long distance relationship?
body: My (30 f) bf (27m) is currently living about 5 hours away until he can save enough to move to NYC to be together. We are in a communication loop about an issue with his new female friends. This was supposed to be temporary living situation until he’s able to move closer.. he took a job at a restaurant and immediately started hanging with all of the 20-23 year old girls that work there and is out almost every night. He insists it’s normal to have friends that are girls and wouldn’t care if I was out with guys. Some nights he crashes on couches and his phone is dead. He thinks that when I get upset it’s out of insecurity and that I’m projecting it onto the situation. When he’s visited me, his phone is going off with texts from them all.. To me it’s really more about seeing red flags in a partner than it is about trusting him.. I’m over having a bf that’s at the bar every night and I feel it’s normal to express that it’s frustrating me, but all he hears is me getting upset when he’s out with “friends”. I can’t tell if I’m overreacting because of his constant shutting down my feelings. I don’t like how we are communicating about it.

WIBTA If I Didn't Let My Friend Stay the Night for the Weekend?
body:
I (21F) have this friend (20F) who is a commuter. Since we go to school in the city, it takes about two hours for her to get home and she spends money to do so. She slept in my dorm a lot last year when she didn't want to go home because I had a situation where I had an extra bed in my dorm. She did this a lot last year. Basically, we have this event coming up that is an entire weekend (Thursday night to Sunday night) and when I didn't have a roommate, I said "if I have a spare bed, it's yours."

But this semester, I have a roommate (22F) who I don't know very well, but seems really nice. On top of this, my friend revealed that she has a friend who is also dorming and has two empty beds in a quad. However, yesterday she texted me saying "I can just leave the sleeping bag under your bed or whatever." However, now that I know there is a better option for both of us (she sleeps in a bed, I don't have to inconvenience my roommate), I kind of want to ask if she can use the other friends' bed.

On top of this, my friend has insomnia and doesn't sleep so we end up staying up really late before I pass out and then she'll listen to podcasts as she falls in and out of sleep. It was really a crazy year when she was my roommate last year as when she actually fell asleep for about an hour at a time, she would either wake me up with her snoring or her screaming from a sleep paralysis demon. I have a chance to mention it before the actual weekend event (we have lunch together on tuesdays and she's coming to sleepover tonight for something).

TD;LR Am I the asshole if I ask my friend to check if she can sleep over her friend's place instead of mine?

Edit/Update: Thanks for the help! She was chill and said that the other friend offered her a bed anyway!! I was just overreacting/overthinking per usual :)

title: AITA for having my 5yo go into a public loos by herself?
body:
Been lurking on reddit for ages without an account, finally made one for this post. 

So I [22M] have a 5yo daughter. Her mum and I aren't together any more, but we share custody 50/50 (she does a week at mum's, a week at mine, so on). Today, I took she and my little stepbrother [12M] to the cinema to to and see Toy Story 4. After we came out of the film, my little girl started complaining that she needed the toilet really badly. She claimed she'd needed to go for ages but didn't want to miss any of the film so she held it. 

This particular cinema is a very small independent local one, and it doesn't have any kind of "family bathroom" or gender neutral option available. Now, in this situation I'd usually just nip my daughter into one of the cubicles of the men's toilets. Except here's the issue; there's only one stall in this men's room at this cinema, and my brother had seen when he'd been in before the film that it was out of order. I asked if she could hold it til we got home, and she said no. Obviously I didn't want her to wet herself, so I told her to run into the ladies really quick and I would wait right outside. 

She went in and came out a short while later accompanied by a very angry woman who basically yelled at me that I was an irresponsible father and didn't I know what could've happened and I should be ashamed of myself. I tried explaining but she didn't want to hear it. Idk I can see why it was a stupid move but it was the only conceivable one, really, given the circumstances. Am I really so irresponsible for doing that, or did she overreact?

title: AITA for being annoyed my gf warned me she will be sad on the anniversary of her brothers death?
body:
My (f29) girlfriend (f35) and I have been together 6 months and just moved in together. She is an extremely thoughtful and caring partner and I'm so glad she'll be with me to celebrate my 30th birthday in February. 

I don't like to set people up for failure and told her explicitly this was an important birthday and that I wanted a day activity and dinner date. I'm always the one who plans our outings whereas she's more effective at beautifying our house and in general just being thoughtful and wonderful. I gave her the heads up because I just don't want to be disappointed but I could tell there was some hesitation / unsuredness around how to treat my birthday. Fast forward to last night and she's sounding out some ideas to me via text. I can tell she's putting some thought into what our activity will be and this makes me extremely happy. As we're discussing what the day is going to look like she goes on to warn me that "One more thing, that's the day my brother passed away and I may be sad that day." This kinda threw me but I wrote to her I was sorry and that we should do something to remember him by. She then responded "No that's okay, I post one picture of him every year on insta but I'm usually sad all day".

Now this is where I ask AITA here for feeling annoyed? The timing is shitty and she's fully entitled to feeling sad on this day but warning me she's going to be in a funk dampens any excitement I had about my birthday. Her brother died 10 years ago and from what I understand she barely saw him growing up due to divorce and long distances. That sounds petty writing out but I know for a fact they weren't close. Still she's a sensitive person and I'm sure her feelings of sadness are genuine. Am I being totally insensitive here? 

Edit: Thanks for the perspective everyone. Some of it was hard to read but all valid criticism. I spoke with her this morning and suggested rescheduling festivities till the week after but apparently the arrangements are set and she'd rather proceed. I in turn will be mindful of the significance this day holds for her and will be supportive, as well as, certainly making sure we celebrate on a alternative day next year. This post certainly served it purpose. Cheers. 

Edit: For the record, I in no way expressed any of my internal conflict to my partner either through words or body language. She was quite surprised when I suggested rescheduling the day for the reasons I provided and was moved by the "thoughtfulness" - which you guys know is undeserved. My initial reaction to the news was to suggest we do something to commemorate him, and I will try and think of some way to involve him in the day or at least make sure he's being remembered through discussion ie. Ask about a favourite memory etc.

body:

Yesterday I was getting beers with the roommate (let’s call him Bob) and he said the GF (we’ll call her Sara) had the flu. title: AITA for spending Thanksgiving with my boyfriend's family rather than my own?
body:
I'll try to condense all the events leading up to my Thanksgiving decision as to not overwhelm the text limit. 

A few months ago, I was the maid of honor at my sister's wedding. As a result, I saw several family members whom I hadn't seen in years. One of them is my Aunt, my dad's sister. At the wedding I gave her a huge hug and excitedly greeted her. She responded with a frown, saying "You don't love us anymore.. we never see you." Despite me explaining that I'm never made aware of the gatherings she throws together from time to time, she continued to guilt me the entire evening. 

Fast forward to last week: My Boyfriend (24m) and I (25f) are newly living together, but we've been dating for almost two years. His family is wonderful!! His mother invited me, and my sister over to her place for Thanksgiving and I gleefully accepted her invitation. But a few days later, my mother informs me that my dad had "already promised my Aunt (from the wedding) that me and my sister would be at her place for Thanksgiving. Mind you, he did so without speaking to us beforehand.

Clearly I recognise that I'm an adult with the capability to make my own decisions, but I know that my Aunt, and all her kids are going to not only guilt me again for not coming, but also guilt my parents for not having us to go. It sounds really petty, but if I'm being honest.. Neither my sister or I even wanted to go. That side of the family is very unpleasant to be around, and they usually party hard with drugs and alcohol involved until the wee hours of the morning.

To top ALL this off, my mother called while she was at my Aunts house last night on Thanksgiving (We could barely hear her over the obnoxious hollering and party music on her end). She asked my sister and I if we can go on a lunch date with my cousin who's in town tomorrow (which is today). We said, "it depends on what time." And mom said, "not sure what time. I'll keep you updated." 

Before going to bed last night, I texted my mother and asked her again, for a time. As my boyfriend and I DO have some black Friday plans around afternoon/evening time. She again says, "not sure. It might be around dinner time." I respond "...But you said lunch.. Dinner won't work for me, I've already got plans around that time." I let her know that I'll probably only be free around breakfast/lunch time. It is now 10am on black Friday, and I haven't heard from her. I am now thinking I may just cancel that lunch date plan, since no one in my family can make plans without it being extremely short notice and inconvenient. (Yes, they've always been short notice kinda people)

Reddit, am I the asshole in all of this? I need some mental reassurance that I'm not crazy.. or maybe I am.

title: WIBTA for asking my Step-Grandmother to 'wait her turn' in the kitchen?
body:
This is kind of long, there's a TL;DR at the bottom. 

I (19M) am currently staying in a house with me, My mother, her husband (my stepfather) and her husbands mother (my Step-grandmother, who we'll call L). L is 86 and is definitely feeling her age, she is fairly immobile and uses 2 walking sticks to get around places. She goes out a fair bit to do standard hobbies that old people do (bingo, gardening that kind of thing) but most of her time during the day consists of her watching TV and moving over to the kitchen to make food. This is where it gets kind of tricky.

L is in the kitchen ALL the time, and by all the time I mean she is ALWAYS there making food or a cup of tea or something. This makes it incredibly hard to do your own thing in the kitchen because, as previously mentioned, L is quite immobile and so it takes forever for her to finish what she's doing. Both me and my Mother get pretty frustrated at this.

My Mother works 12 hour shifts throughout the week and so when she comes home and sees that L is making food or a cup of tea and that she won't be able to do anything in the kitchen until she's done she gets very frustrated. 

She also gets frustrated because L also kind of assumes that my Mother is going to go shopping for her or take her to her Doctor appointments on her days off. Like she'll just be like "I've wrote a shopping list for you" or "My appointment is at x time" and because my Mother is such a kind soul she won't refuse but instead just do it without question and get frustrated about it. 

What's also frustrating is that L won't wait for people to be done before she comes into the kitchen, she has a VERY specific schedule for what time she eats and so if someone is in there at that time she will come in and start doing her thing and quite frankly just get in the way of what you're trying to do. It's frustrating to the point where I'll just straight up leave the kitchen until she's done before I continue.

It's worth mentioning that L is a very nice lady but that there's just some I guess 'unspoken conflict' between who is in what space at what time. So my question to you Reddit is: WIBTA if I were to talk about this with L to try and make things a little less frustrating for my Mother and I? I've spoke to some friends about this and they've said that I would be an asshole for bringing it up and that I should just put up with it because she's old and slow so I'm not sure if I should or not. What is the Internet's opinion?

TL;DR - Me and my Mother are frustrated because my Step-Grandmother is in the kitchen all the time and takes forever. WIBTA for telling her to politely fuck off until people are finished doing their own thing?

title: AITA for not opening the door for my neighbours?
body:
For context, I am a 20F with severe anxiety and periodic depressive cycles. Also, I have polycystic ovary syndrome, so my period is HELL, and it tends to take my bad side out to play.

I've lived with my parents in an apartment building for all my life, and I have the WORST neighbours, they're a family of at least 3 generations, and live in a 2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment just above ours. They had a leak that affected my apartment for 10 years, make noise (Music, loud talking, fights, or just hammering, or idk what they do) untill AT LEAST 11-12pm every day, with some pull all nighters, they have a giant black dog who's trained to attack everyone (Even them), they're antisocial too, they smoke/sell drugs/have s\*x/fight/sleep in the public stairs, steal the lightbulbs, pee on the floor, and even have robbed people inside the building.

Nobody says anything and our landlords haven't done anything in all those years because they're scared of them.

(Note: It's really difficult to take legal action against them because they've family in the police, and I live in a pretty corrupt country)

So, one of the many things they do is that the entrance of the buiding has a key that only owners have, and NONE of them seems to have one, so they always demand (Here's one of my issues, they DEMAND instead of asking) the others to open the door for them.

I'm a polite person though I don't talk a lot, I just greet people, smile, do favours if I'm asked, and try to be as kind as I can. I even gave my boyfriend a key so he won't bother anyone. Nobody in my building can say I'm rude.... Except them.

Enough context.

Yesterday, my dad was waiting for me outside the building, I have 3 days failing to eat/sleep well because of stress, and I'm bleeding out of my vag like there's no tomorrow. I'm getting out of the building with my boyfriend and one of my neighbours is waiting outside for someone to open the door for him. I'm really done with life, so I just open the door, wait for my boyfriend to pass and try to close it without letting the other guy in. And he SLAMS his hand on the door and pushes past me to get in anyways.

I lost it.

I questioned him about why he doesn't have a key, and when he told me it wasn't my problem, I started screaming at him about all the things they do wrong all the time, and said that I don't have to open the door for him because he doesn't deserve it. I can swear I was about to hit him.

My dad hops in and ends up finishing the fight and taking me away. By the time I'm in the car, I'm crying and shaking in pure rage, and my dad is scolding me like mad. He says that I shouldn't fight with them because they're antisocials, and I'm a 5f/130lbs girl. My mom agreed with him, so they're all mad at me now and won't talk to me.

I get I was reckless, but we've taken SO MUCH from them at this point, and I'm tired of being abused, I don't think I deserve to be punished. AITA?

title: AITA for not wanting to renew the lease with my roommate?
body:
My [24f] friend/roommate [25F] told me about 2.5 weeks ago she wants to move out and live with her boyfriend, after I had said that I wanted to renew the lease — after being promoted by our landlord to discuss it. It was a surprise to me because they have only been dating a few months. It also turns out that they hadn’t had a discussion about it yet, so nothing was set in stone, but she assured me it was a done deal.

I started to look for a roommate and, luckily for me, one of my best friends from uni moved back to my area and started to look for a place. I told her my situation and she said it would be a good idea to live together again.

This worked out perfectly for everyone because my roommate could move out and my friend could move in with no hard feelings. This worked out best for me because my current roommate is passive aggressive and I don’t feel comfortable talking to her about issues in our living space — I just end up bottling everything up and resenting her (though I’ve been trying to let things go). We definitely get along, but there are a lot of things that bother me and I don’t feel that I can voice those grievances to her.

After a few conversations about her situation, we both came to the conclusion that she was going to move in with the boyfriend and that she would tell me by today (after popping the question this weekend) because we need to renew the lease 1 May, which would give me two weeks to figure everything out.

She told me they haven’t talked yet, but that they would this week.

I feel jerked around by her and I am done with this living situation, especially with her lack of regard for my own living arrangements. I have decided that regardless of whether or not she will move into her boyfriend’s I will be moving in the my old college roommate when my lease is over. Am I the asshole?

title: AITA for wanting my BF to do more chores?
body:
I (25F) am unemployed. I quit my last job and I'm working tirelessly to get a job. I live with my BF (32M) who works FT in retail. When not at work, he's on his computer. Because I'm home all day, I agreed to take on more chores. But we both agreed that cleaning shouldn't be my full responsibility.

A few years ago, the roles were reversed and he was the unemployed one, at home playing video games. I was working two jobs to make ends meet for us. He didn't help too much with chores then either (because we had a third roommate who loved cleaning).

Here's how it goes: I'll mention about wanting us to get some cleaning done tomorrow and he agrees. The next day comes and we wake up, chill out for a couple hours, and then I slowly start making my way to cleaning. He'll still be sitting at his comp. I'll mention something in passing like, "do you mind doing the dishes" or "could you take care of your pile of clean clothes in the bedroom" or "do you mind changing the water in your fish tank" (because I'm so small so I really struggle picking up the buckets of water that high and stuff AND ITS HIS TANK -- fish keep dying because he won't take care of it) and he just goes BANANAS! 

"*Sigh* okay yeah fine but *I work all day* I really just wish you did this stuff while I'm at work"

What I do for chores:
- our laundry 
- clean the bathroom
- vacuum
- clean 2 other fish tanks
- take care of our bird
- dust
- de-clutter

What he does for chores:
- water changes on the large tank
- he mopped the kitchen last week

We agree to swap dishes duty every-other time. But when it's his turn, he'll let the sink pile with dishes on both sides for days until it smells and we have no dishes. And even then, he's asked me in the past, "what do I need to do to make you take my turn haha" or sometimes he'll do only half of them at a time, let it pile up again, and the cycle continues for a couple weeks. And sometimes he leaves the ickiest ones on the bottom and say he "can't deal with the smell" and asks me to finish them. 

After he's done moaning and groaning through a chore or two, he sits back in front of his comp and vapes while I'm still running around trying to clean the place. If I ask him to do another thing it's a big *sigh* as he gets up to go do it and says again "I work all week and my back/shoulder hurts." 

While cleaning last week, my boyfriend told me at least twice "you don't need to make it that clean in here jeez" My blood boils just thinking about it. What the fuck is wrong with a house that's clean? Our apartment itself is already a dumpy place. I also have MDD and the clutter makes me feel 10x worse. I just wish he would help more and not make me feel like a grade A piece of shit when I ask him to scrub the toilet.

AITA for being upset with my BF because he won't pitch in without being mean about it? I don't want him to start falling into a groove of me picking up after him for the rest of our life together. I'd love to know everyones POV.

title: WIBTA if I gave back my father's Christmas presents?
AITA for getting my brother a mop for his bday?
body:
I (18F) was home from uni, and my mum had told me clean the house. I did, and was just going to get some water from the kitchen. My brother(23M) was there refilling his water bottle from the fridge water dispenser. His attention was completely on his phone not the bottle, so it spilled onto the floor and down the sides of the fridge. This is not the first time it happened. 

I told him to clean it up, because i just swept and mopped the house (which he did not help once btw). He said no, its just water. I pressed again because i will not do it. He said no and told me to fuck myself. Ok i told him he’s a POS and went and poured water in front of his bedroom, which he a few hours later did the same back to me. title: WIBTA If I estranged myself from my(M19) parents(M39&F35)?
body:
I will have background info in a comment.

My dad and my stepmom very seldom contact me if ever. However, they get upset when I don't contact them back. I spent this summer in a different state visiting my girlfriend and working with her dad at his company. I received 3 texts total from my parents, and no incoming phone calls. I called them twice and texted multiple times. They have always been this way.

Recently, my dad and I were discussing sleeping arrangements if my girlfriend were to visit over thanksgiving. My dad told me they would rather we stayed with him instead of my grandparents, who had offered to let us stay at their house as they practically raised me. I had no qualms with my dad's decision, but my dad started texting me sporadically again, and when I called, he sent me to voicemail after two rings. I thought, "maybe he's just on the phone, I'll call my stepmom." Same thing. I then called the house phone, and it turns out kids were being put to bed. I asked to call once they were done, and I got the following texts. (M-me, D-dad)

M "Can I call?"

D "At this point I am very upset and I don't think it's a good time to call."

M "Who are you upset at?"

D "Good night."

M "There's obviously something going on here that I am unaware of, who are you upset at? If it's me, what did I do?"

That was 6 days ago and I still haven't gotten a response.

I also texted my stepmom (S-stepmom).

M "Are you also upset to the point of ignoring me?"

S "Upset yes. Ignoring no."

M "At me?"

*20 minutes later*

M "I'll take that as a yes."

S "Sorry we are watching the end of Jumanji."

That was also 6 days ago, and I still haven't gotten a response.

This isn't the sole reason that I'm considering estranging myself, (that would be extreme), but instead its the last straw.

I'm not close to my parents, as you can see. I'm sick of conversations like this where I'm told nothing and then shamed afterwards. I'm sick of being told that "I'm an adult and can make my own choices" and then having my dad and stepmom be mad at me for months afterwards since it wasn't the decision they wanted. I'm sick of my stepmom's narcissistic behavior, and my dad not doing/saying anything about it. I'm sick of being told that I don't visit enough when no one invites me. I'm sick of being treated like I'm invisible when I do come home. (My dad never talks to me, always asks other kids to help him, for example, change the oil). I'm sick of my parents making mistakes and not taking the responsibility for it, and instead blaming everyone else around them, (such as me making "poor choices" since I'm not religious like them and thus means I "must not have morals and ethics"). All of this stresses me out.

WIBTA if I just cut communications with my parents so I don't have to put up with this behavior?

TL;DR: My parents struggle to communicate with me and I don't want to deal with it, and I don't want to deal with my stepmom at all any more.

title: WIBTA if I moved out of my dorm?
body:
I (18F) am a freshman Mechanical Engineering(ME) college student and my roommate (18F) is a freshman Musical Theater(MT) college freshman, we are currently going to a University in the US. The first couple of days was fine not problems with eachother at all, but then the first weekend rolled around and she decided to go party with a couple of friends at a MT sorority house. I was fine with it, but I had to go to bed early because I had ME orientation the next day. Later that night she comes back around 3 or 4 am making a lot of noise and is noticeably drunk. This wakes me up and once I'm awake it's really hard to fall back asleep.  The next day she apologizes for waking me up but she was just so drunk she had a hard time staying quiet. I didnt really care at first because this is college and maybe this is her way of adjusting. 

The next weekend rolls around and the same thing happens except this time she went to a baseball party and one of the guys there took advantage of her drunkenness. Now she told me about it the next day and I obviously wanted to help her , I suggested seeing a counselor, telling someone with authority, and even going to the health center to get checked. She said she would do those things but never actually told me if she did. The whole week after that she was a mess, which is understandable, but it also made me not want to go back to my dorm. Instead of going back I would try and stay out and study for as long as I could take it because i really didnt want to go back and have to console my upset roomate. But when I would do that my roomate would be upset with me for staying away because she wanted someone to talk to about this even though I feel like that isn't my job. 

So week 3 of classes rolls around and my classes are really ramping up. This happened last week during the weekdays which is the reason I decided I wanted to move. On a weeknight she decides to go out with some friends, and I had two tests tomorrow morning which meant I had to go to bed early and she knew this. Lo and behold she comes back at 2am and wakes me up. The next morning she gets up an hour before she normally does and an hour before I need to wake up, and all the noise she made woke me up so I just stayed in bed trying to fall back asleep but couldn't. At this point I'm really angry and sleep deprived so I confronted her about everything later that night, and she basically blamed me for our roomate problems. The one thing that stuck out to me and made me more angry is that she said "I understand that you're an only child and this transition has been hard for you but you really need to learn how to compromise." I've been really upset since and ever since I talked to her about it shes been sleeping at our neighbors dorm because "She doesnt want to wake me up and make me angry." 

I can't tell if I'm in the right to move out or if I being an unreasonable roomate, AITA?

title: WIBTA for buying my siblings alarm clocks?
body:
I'm 16 and in sixth form, which starts at 8am. I have a sister, 14, in high school with a 9am start time, and a brother, 12, in a different high school with an 8:30 start time.

Since I was about 13 our mum started working in the next town over, which requires her leaving at 6am for work, and my sister started going to high school with me, so it became my job to make sure both siblings were awake and going to school.

As college starts at 8am for me, and I have to leave at 7:30, what I've been doing for the last week or so is waking both siblings about 20 minutes before I leave, and checking they're awake 10 minutes later. So I get them up for about 7:10-7:15 and they have to take over from there.

My brother's school is 2 blocks from our house and my sister's school is about 15 minutes away when walking.

My brother is fairly independent, always gets up immediately, can get himself breakfast and get dressed and out the door. He's got his own house key and is capable of locking the door behind him, and a phone to ring me or mum in case of emergencies and let us know he got to school on time.

My sister is another story. She's not a morning person in any sense of the words. I can wake her up, watch her get out of bed, go get herself some cereal, and then I'll go check on her and she's in bed, asleep again. IDK how she does it.

This morning my phone was dead, so my alarm didn't go off. I woke up around 7:45 and had to rush through my morning routine, wake up both siblings right before I left, and barely made it to class on time.

My brother got up immediately, saw the time, and raced through his routine.

I had knocked on my sister's door before I left, and my brother says he yelled for her to get up, but around 9:30 I got a call from my sister asking why no one had woken her, as she was now late for school, and blaming me for not making sure she was up.

I've resolved to get myself a proper alarm clock in case my phone battery ever dies again or for some reason doesn't go off. I'm buying it from a nearby store which is currently doing 3 for 2 on household electronics, including digital alarm clocks.

As we all need to get up at different times, I think it would make sense to buy 3 alarms, one each, and that way everyone can set their clock to whenever they want and I don't have to worry about making sure everyone is up on time.

title: WIBTA if I tell my Best Friends Fiance she lied about wanting kids?
body:
Apologies for format, am on an old cell phone. 

My (31F) best friend (let's called her Anne, 31f) is engaged and getting married this April, I am her Maid of Honor. Her Fiance (let's call him Dan, 33M) is best friends with my BF (who is also supposed to be the Best Man in this Wedding) 
We introduced them almost 5 years ago. 

Dan works for his  family owned business and is quite well off, Anne used to be a Social worker (like myself) but has left this last year to be an "Instagram Influencer" which Dan has supported her with, and has been paying for her lifestyle.

A week ago, Anne and I got together with a few friends for wine and dinner. Anne's wedding came up and someone brought up how extravagant the wedding will be, due to Dan and his family being so well off.  She starting laughing and somewhat bragging about Dan (I don't blame her, he is a great guy) and talking about how amazing their lives will be (she had a bit to drink at this point, and was a little tipsy) 

Naturally the topic of Kids came up, and that's where things took a turn. I myself have been apart of many conversations between the two where they have talked about having kids, ( they even have name picked out) and how excited they are to start a family within the first year of marriage, well, I guess it's actually just him that's excited. Anne starts going on about her Instagram career (which she swears will take off soon) and that she has no interest in ruining her body by having kids. I stayed quiet after that.

Later when I was driving her home, I brought it up and asked her when she changed her mind, she then said she never had intentions of having kids and only went along with it to please Dan, hoping he would change his mind eventually and appreciate just it being them. I asked her if she told him, she laughed and said no, I then I asked her if she planned to before they got married, she again said no. I kind of went off at her, saying how she needs to have this discussion before they got married and how dishonest it was, and asked how she planned on getting away with it. She then said she's staying on the pill, and maybe after "struggling" to get pregnant, he will change his mind, and then who knows maybe she will change her mind down the line. 

We fought the whole way back to her place, which ended with me telling her she better tell Dan. She called me the next day to ask if that was a threat, and started begging me not to ruin her life. I felt bad and told her I loved her, but that she had no right to go into marriage being deceitful, she then said having a baby is a huge change, and that it's her choice not to ruin her body or lifestyle. I agreed and said it was her body and her choice, however that doesn't mean she gets to lie to Dan about the family and future he thinks he's going to have, and that if she doesn't tell him, I would.

AITA

Edit: also wanted to add that her sister (who is also in the wedding party) came to see me. She told me Anne told me that in confidence, and that I am not a couple's counselor or Anne's therapist so I have no right to be offering threats and opinions about someone else's relationship, and how I should be more sympathetic to Anne's situation.

Edit: so, she told him she got drunk and had a moment where she said she was worried about having kids because her Instagram career was taking off , that I over reacted and twisted the conversation on her and that was threatening her, Dan called my Boyfriend to demand why I would do something like that to Anne, especially when she was clearly just panicking about the future and needed a friend. 

I told my boyfriend everything, how I wanted Anne to have the chance to come clean to Dan first, because I knew if I told him, he would tell Dan himself, I showed him the messages between myself, Anne and her sister to back myself up. He has now sent them to Dan.

Edit: after my BF sent the messages, we never heard back from Dan. My BF then sent a few more asking if everything was alright  before telling him to call us if he needed anything, he got a text back around 3am saying "Thanks" 

I just woke up and am no longer apart of the Bridal Party WhatsApp group, and am either blocked across all social media with Anne or she has deleted her accounts ( more then likely the first one though) 

And to answer a question (sorry I didn't go into detail prior) It's not just her body she was worried about, she has no interest in the lifestyle change that comes with being a parent. She wants to just live her life traveling and have fun, not having to worry about putting someone else first, or being judged on the internet (woops) for being conceited if she acted that way if she was a mom.

Edit: My BF and I have talked to Dan, he's pretty torn up and isn't sure how to feel. Somehow Anne has made him feel like he forced her into saying she wanted kids, so now he feels guilty, but also realizes there was no trust as she felt she couldn't tell him this the whole time they were together, he also spoke to his dad who is now convinced she was in it for the money (which I guess he has felt the whole time)

My BF and I told Dan he didn't force her into anything, and that he has nothing to feel guilty about, having Kids or not can be the deal breaker in any relationship, and she took advantage of his desire to start a family, Dan still wants to be with her though as I guess she also started back pedaling when he told her maybe they should call it quits, and gave him the whole " maybe I will change my mind"  or  "we could hire a Surrogate or something if you really want one" 

Dan said the Surrogate thing feels like rich privilege though, and feels wrong considering there are women out there who can't get Pregnant, while as far as he knows, Anne is fine, and feels as though Anne is probably taking advantage of his families wealth.

My BF jokingly him to tell Anne he wants a prenup, and for her to get a real job, and see if she still wants to stay, but Joking aside, he deserves better and that while he will still support him in his choice, his view of her is forever altered with how she treated Dan and myself.

Dan said he has alot to think about, and as of right now Anne is at her mom's.

Edit: Hi everyone, not sure if you will see this as it has been a few days, But Anne and Dan have broken up. She messaged me 2 days ago, going off about how I was always a wolf in sheep skin, that I was jealous of her because I settled for my BF and would of never had a chance with Dan (wtf?) And that she hopes I die. I told her to try be less manipulative next time she finds herself in a relationship and to have a good life.

I guess she posted some sob story to her followers, and finished with how she was going to come out "stronger" from this, but that she has to take time away to recollect herself (as in, another way to make money) 

Dan is.... Not doing so good, but my BF is an amazing friend to him and has been doing what he can to help him, Dan feels embarrassed, and I guess his family keeps saying "I told you so", so Dan has been burying himself in his work and hanging out with my BF and I

Thanks everyone for the comments, I showed Dan this thread and he read it for close to a hour, laughed and said he had no idea Reddit was supportive like this!

title: AITA For cooking meat in front of vegans?
body:
So I (18m) have been having some problems with my parents recently. Both are Vegan, my dad by necessity and my stepmum by choice.

My stepmum has been vegan for years while my dad has only become fully vegan in the last year or so.

Recently I've been butting heads with my parents. They say it's unfair for me to expect them to put up with the smell of me cooking meat in the house. My stepmum has even claimed that when I cook red meat she can't sleep for days due to the smell making her feel sick.

I try and cook my meals when they're not home as much as I can, but between work, university and being with friends its hard.

I've tried to reach compromises on some of the points they make several times but they refuse my suggestions. Some examples:

-They don't like the frying pans/pots being used for meat
 =I suggest I buy my own and keep them in my room
-They don't like meat/animal products in the fridge
=I suggest I buy a mini fridge for my own food
-They hate the smell
=I suggest cooking a handful of my meals in one go and keep them in the fridge so I'm not cooking all week

I currently live here for free which is why I feel I might be pushing things a bit. AITA for not budging and arguing back with them on this?

title: AITA for shouting at other people’s children because they were misbehaving and causing a ruckus?
body:
So context: My(M19) family and a few other families (we’re all Asians) went on a holiday together. So the families only know each other because my younger brother(12) is school friends with them. 

Due to our large group there are obviously going to be a lot of children about 11 in total aged 8-13 all boys. When travelling from place to place it was more convenient to rent a bus. So how it happened is that the young kids rush to the back to take the last row. As there’s only 5 sears on the last row it’s basically a first come first served basis. So the rest of the children would have to sit elsewhere in front of them.

So what happened is that the last 2 rows were occupied by children and I was sitting on the third last row with no one next to me. The bus ride to our next destination was quite long so I decided to take a nap. But half way to dreamland one of the kids(M8) was kicking my seat. So I politely asked him to stop. He then complained that it was because i reclined my seat a bit to lie down and sleep. Of course I told him he could recline his too. This was when I noticed the problem.

The children were arguing because the row at the back couldn’t recline their seats as it was the last row. So they took their frustration out on the children(younger than them) sitting in the row in front of them. And of course this was then taken out on me because I was on the third last row. The adults on the trip are pretty laid back and let their kids run a bit wild so I felt quite annoyed that the kids couldn’t solve this problem.

At first I tried to get their attention so I could give a solution, but of course, kids enjoy bickering and ignored me. So due to a long ride in the bus, and probably some frustration, I shouted at the kids to get their attention and told them quite angrily “Those that want to sit in the back you chose there so don’t complain when those sitting in the second last row recline their seats. If you don’t like it go sit somewhere else on the bus!” 

So I was probably very loud and pissed off because all the adults turned to look at me. Later my parents told me that even if the kids were in the wrong I have no right to shout at them. It puzzled me a little because 
1. I sort of solved their problem 
2. Where do I draw the line between being responsible for these young children due to being an older ‘child’ and helping solve their arguments.
