title: AITA for slurping at home?
body:
At home I like to slurp certain things like soup or coffee, but my girlfriend says I am egoistical and an asshole for doing so. I think it tastes better that way, it also gets cooler while slurping and the way I see it, it doesn't harm anyone. At least in my own home I don't want to focus on eating according to social norms. Since it doesn't actually harm my girlfriend I think it would be better to let it go and learn to be above this as well. She unnecessarily loses a lot of nerves in her daily life, over something that has virtually no effect on her personally. For her it would be a gain to overcome her kind-of-ocd condition, for me it would mean a loss to never slurp again. 

Additionally she compared her being annoyed to having  depression. we have this ongoing discussion in which I try to convince her that depressed people deserve empathy and consideration, not judgement for being to egoistical to just get help. She argued I wouldn't show empathy for her disorder, but for depression, which is unfair.

title: AITA For requesting an access for a remote desktop to late?
body:
So the holidays are coming up and our company is closed during the last week of the year. 


Since a colleague and I have to monitor some processes during this time, we have to do this at home.

She owns a Laptop with a remote access to her work PC. I don't have this but I arranged that I can take home the laptop from another colleague. 

Since I've never worked with this remote programm at all, my colleague asked me, if I requested an access at our IT-Department for this remote thing. I obviously said no, because I didn't know that I even need a separate account for this stuff. 
So I wrote a Mail on monday and until yesterday I got no answer from IT. My colleague got really mad at me, when I told her I still have no response from IT. She got mad because I didn't request the access early enough and was pissed and said that she's sick of doing these kind of tasks alone and kind of stormed out of the office and she hasn't talked to me since.

My colleague, from whom I will borrow the laptop, said nothing either and told me that everything will work and I just have to log on normally.

So, am I the asshole here?

title: AITA For Roasting My Cousin Online
body:
I am asexual(25F) and while it is not a secret, I don't go around telling people that.

My cousin(21F) somehow knew about this and out of nowhere assumed that we are the best of best friends. You see, despite being a norm, she adores the LGBT community, with her social media full of related quotes, arguments, research links and pictures of herself with a bunch of people whom you cannot call "him" or "her" carelessly. 

She insisted that I, too, belongs to the LGBT community(which I couldn't care less) and tried to introduce me to her LGBT friends. I have nothing against LGBT(more like simply not interested), but I do not like making friends with complete strangers, especially since my cousin herself had made me warned me to be careful how I speak with them. 

It gets quite frustrating over time, it's like she just keep buzzing around me and tell me about everything she knows about asexual people(I only know myself, why should I be bothered with other asexual people), about her amazing transgender or gay friends(again, nothing to do with me) and about how I should "come out"(come out where? Must I announce it everywhere I go? Coz that sounds really silly). I have been either ignoring her or decling as politely as I could. 

Then there came a day I was went to an Anime convention, met a male cosplay that did a really good job of my favorite character(see username), so I asked to take a picture with him and after some chat, added him as a friend. Later that day I posted the picture on my social media, tagging him.

My dear cousin left a comment "You did tell him that you are asexual right?". And ofcourse, since I tagged the cosplay guy I assume he saw that comment too. I am pretty certain I added him as a normal friend, and he knew that too. That does not mean, however, that I have the need to tell him I am asexual.

I replied to her comment "I have seen freaks, dicks and pricks, and you are identified as all three."

She is now trying to shame me and tell everybody that I am transphobic and homophobic, great. I don't regret roasting her like that though, AITA?
